entry.title: Evan Buckley's (Unhepful) Guide to Parallel Universes
entry.summary:
Author: Monogums

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,851Chapters: 3/13Kudos: 9

Summary: When Buck has a brush with death, the last thing he expects is to wake up with a new identity. Or deal with zombies. Or the paparazzi. But life can be strange. Especially his, apparently. - Or: in which Buck lives a series of parallel lives after a near-death experience. Somehow, Eddie is there. Every. Time.

entry.title: I thought that I heard you laughing
entry.summary:
Author: numberonehangsterfan

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,393Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Football player Buck is a running back for the USC Trojans who has a tendency to run fast and think later. During USC's annual rivalry game against the Notre Dame Fighting Irish, a particularly hard tackle sends Buck flying out of bounds and straight into the other team. An unlucky player with strikingly brown eyes doesn't manage to dive out of Buck's path in time.

entry.title: The Shape of Things Falling Apart
entry.summary:
Author: 79_50

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,168Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 44

Summary: After Chris moves in with Buck, Eddie Diaz does what he‚Äôs always done best: he takes control. He plans. He prepares. He makes sure there are no loose ends. Buck watches the man he loves grow quieter, calmer, and terrifyingly resolved, and realises too late that Eddie isn‚Äôt coping. He‚Äôs preparing. This is a story about love, guilt, and what happens when someone decides the best way to protect the people they love is to disappear.

entry.title: Just one more breath
entry.summary:
Author: CarpeDiem911

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,132Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 291

Summary: The hysterical laughter stole every coherent thought from Buck and crawled into his bones; his heart thudded and he stared at the doll in disbelief. Then, as suddenly as it had started, the laughter stopped; leaving an eerie silence. Buck stood frozen, his thoughts like thick mud, staring at that stupid doll. He completely missed the huge hole in the wall above the tub. He missed the shadow standing there, watching him from behind the hole with cold eyes and a malicious smile.

Author: mythicalinker

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,979Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 6

Summary: You see, all Buck wanted was his cheap five-dollar phone charger. Instead, he got a front-row seat to the scandal of the century. Returning to the station on his day off, Buck catches his long-time crush, Eddie, in a heated, compromising moment with the last person on Earth he expected: Chimney, his own brother-in-law. In one heartbeat, Buck‚Äôs world is trashed. His secret pining for Eddie is met with the ultimate betrayal, and his sister‚Äôs marriage is suddenly a ticking time bomb.

entry.title: The Shape of What Remained
entry.summary:
Author: MMMafterdark

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,907Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 89

Summary: After a hit and run leaves Buck without his memories, he wakes up in a hospital alone. Meanwhile, the 118, fractured by loss, realizes too late that Buck has disappeared right in front of them. ______ Ravi is the one who finally voices what they are all thinking. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe Buck could have been missing for seventy two hours and none of us realized.‚Äù No one argues with him. They are all painfully aware of how fractured the team has become since Bobby‚Äôs death. The station no longer carries the warmth and ease it once did, even as it now bears his name. They had been lost in their own lives and their own heads, and somewhere in that quiet unraveling, Buck slipped through the cracks. ______ Or: a Buck whump crash-out fic to rewrite season 9.
